results.title: A Tale of mail
results.creator_credit: Donald Stearn, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film made in co-operation with the Canadian Post Office in which the artist has free rein to show how he thinks letters travelled from one place to another in the early days of transportation. A lively presentation of historical facts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Stearn, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A State funeral for Alec Campbell: the last Anzac
results.creator_credit: Greg Simson, Tracey Smith and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Described as charming, determined but also quite humble, a man of peace, widely respected and with many friends, Alec Campbell (1899-2002) was affectionately remembered as the last Anzac. He was born in Launceston, Tasmania, educated at Scotch College, Launceston and at the tender age of sixteen, successfully enlisted (by lying about his age) in the Army, in the 15th Battalion headed for Gallipoli. His time spent in Gallipoli was very brief - 2 months as a water carrier, but Alec has become part of the Anzac legend, however reluctantly, and on his passing on 16 May 2002 was given the honour of a State funeral as the last Anzac who fought in Gallipoli. This video is of the television broadcast of Alec Campbell’s State Funeral Service which was held at the Cathedral Church of Saint David in Hobart, Tasmania on Friday 24 May 2002. Hosted by Judy Tierney, Peter Gee and Lt. Col. John Moore, the program begins with a portrait of Alec Campbell’s life and achievements through interviews with his family and including stills, archival newsreel footage and family photos. This is then followed by a complete broadcast of the funeral service. A great tribute to a man who perhaps was somewhat bewildered by all the fuss and attention he received in his final years - a gentle man.

results.title: A Star named Ayrton Senna
results.creator_credit: Jean-Claude Guiter, FOCA and Instituto Ayrton Senna
results.brief_description: A Star Named Ayrton Senna is an insightful and intimate documentary about the Brazilian Formula 1 Champion who died tragically in May 1994. Includes interviews with Senna’s relatives and friends as well as people he worked with in the Grand Prix circuit. Fans of Ayrton Senna the man and also Formula One will enjoy the many frank interviews with Senna, as well as footage of him racing (including his days of racing Go-Carts!) and also his normal life away from the Grand Prix hysteria. Senna’s views on life and his professionalism are beautifully presented and the documentary also gives an interesting insight into the stresses and strains of fame. In English and Portugese with English subtitles.

results.title: A Star is lost
results.creator_credit: John Howe, Daisy Bellefeuille, John Smith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A musical comedy feature about the trials and tribulations of making an old-time musical spectacular a la Busby Berkeley era of MGM. Take an inexperienced studio head, add a villainous competitor, an eccentric director, and an exquisite star who has never sung a note in her life, and you’ve got problems! But they’re nothing to compare with the situation once your exquisite star … is lost.

results.title: A Shifting Heart
results.brief_description: The 2nd Vatican Council, held in Rome in the 1960s, saw a massive restructuring of how Catholics approach their faith. For Australians this has meant a great deal of alteration in externals, for example the Mass today is spoken in English rather than Latin, - plus there has been a reassessment of the role of the individual Catholic in the modern world. The Roman Catholic faith has entered tumultuous times and few Catholics can idly stand by and watch the church disintegrate. However, there is an increasing mood among many Catholic lay people of assertiveness which promises well for the church’s future. Rated: G

results.title: A Star is born [Streisand]
results.creator_credit: Frank Pierson, Jon Peters, Barwood Films, First Artists and Time-Warner
results.brief_description: This third version of the classic Hollywood story of success and failure, exhilaration and despair, takes place against the high pressure background of big-time rock and roll. Barbra Streisand and Kris Kristofferson play the two lovers whose paths intersect but cannot parallel. For him, it’s too late to start over. For her it’s too early to slow down.

results.title: A Special time
results.creator_credit: Doug Johnson, Julie Johnson, Warren Johnson and Perennial Productions
results.brief_description: Full of practical suggestions on how to have fun with children, this film stresses that the sharing of appropriate ‘play’ activities can improve the quality of a family’s life through a very special bonding.

results.title: A Special place
results.creator_credit: Bill Pettigrew, Bill Brind and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An absorbing, eye-opening view of Canada’s National Parks, illustrated by the activities of the parks staff - naturalists, geologists, park wardens and others who ensure that these special places remain that way. Mountain rescue, avalanche control, health services to animals, information service to visitors, restocking fishing waters - these and many other responsibilities occupy the National Parks officers. It is a view of the Canadian wilderness that encourages understanding and confidence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Pettigrew, Bill Brind and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Song for Tibet
results.creator_credit: Anne Henderson, Abbey Jack Neidik, Kent Martin, Arcady Films, D L I Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Two Tibetans-in-exile, living in Canada tell of their efforts to preserve the culture and religion of Tibet under the occupation. They journey to India to meet the Dali Lama. Narrated by Thubten Samdup and Dicki Chhoyang.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anne Henderson, Abbey Jack Neidik, Kent Martin, Arcady Films, D L I Productions and National Film Board of Canada
